org.daisy.streamline.api.media

Interface InputStreamSupplier

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AnnotatedInputStream
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultAnnotatedInputStream

    public interface InputStreamSupplier
    Provides an supplier of input streams for a resource.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getSystemId()
      Gets the system identifier.
      java.io.InputStream newInputStream()
      Creates a new input stream for the resource.

    • Method Detail

      • newInputStream

        java.io.InputStream newInputStream()
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new input stream for the resource.
        Returns:
        the input stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • getSystemId

        java.lang.String getSystemId()

        Gets the system identifier. The system identifier can be included in error messages and warnings.

        If the system identifier is a URL, it can also be used to resolve links to relative resources. However, one should keep in mind that the content of the resource at the specified URL might not be identical to the content supplied by newInputStream(). The URL might even point to a non-existing resource. For these reasons, a consumer should avoid opening a connection to the URL and instead use newInputStream().

        If the system identifier is a URL, it must be fully resolved (it may not be a relative URL).

        Returns:
        the system identifier
